Center: OECD/NEA Nuclear Data Bank, Boulogne-Billancourt, France
ref: Jour: Applied Radiation and Isotopes, Vol.66, p.1337 (2008)
title: Evaluation of irradiation parameters of enriched Xe-124 target for I-123 production in cyclotrons.

x4freetext: Evaluation of irradiation parameters of enriched Xe-124
target for I-123 production in cyclotrons.

x4codes.shortRef: Jour: Applied Radiation and Isotopes, Vol.66, p.1337 (2008)

x4codes.hlp: Inst.de Pesquisas Energeticas e Nucleares, Sao Paulo, Brazil

x4freetext: An isotopically enriched Xe-124 target was used.
The experimental target system was made of copper
coated by a thin layer of nickel. two molybdenum foils,
cooled by a compressed flux of helium gas, were set
between the target and beam line.

x4codes.hlp: Inst.de Pesquisas Energeticas e Nucleares, Sao Paulo, Brazil

x4freetext: The Cyclone-30 cyclotron installed at
IPEN.
All irradiations were carried out at a beam
current ranging from 10 to 30 muA between 20 and 40 min
given an average integrated current at the target of
*By authors*.After EOB, the target was allowed a
cooling time for the Cs-123 to decay to Xe-123 and
The recovery of high-purity I-123 adsorbed on the walls
of the target chamber was performed by washing with
water. The effects of the length of time that the water
remained inside the target and the heating temperature
were studied. this procedure was made in order to
improve the removing of the I-123 from the target wall,
thereby decreasing product losses.
The experimental I-123 yield was determined as a
function of the decay time after the EOB and as a
function of the temperature target chamber to remove
I-123 from the walls and as a function the gas Xe-124
load pressure.
S.B
*By authors*.The Xe-124 pressure was 1.8*10E+3 hPa
and the decay time after EOB was fixed at 7 Hr. The
target heating time was fixed at 10 min at 65C-degree.
